name: Graeme Labrooy
bio: Graeme Fredrick Labrooy (Sinhala: ග්‍රැහැම් ලැබ්‍රෝයි; born June 7, 1964, in Colombo) is a former Sri Lankan cricketer who played in nine Tests and 44 ODIs from 1986 to 1992.[1] He was the chairman of selectors for the national team and currently serves as an international match referee.[2] His younger brother Wendell Labrooy is also a first-class cricketer and match referee.[3][4] Labrooy holds the unique distinction of never playing any of his nine test matches at home. He had modelled his text book bowling action on Richard Hadlee and he was regarded as a huge fan of Hadlee.[5]
